column1: # each line is an entry menu. the menu supports three types of items.
# group: it's just a header to categorize the menu
#       for groups you have to enter three fields like this:
# mbase: is a normal mystic base

column4: select * from bbs where mgroups like '%fsx%'
select * from bbs where mgroups like '%zero%'
select * from bbs where mgroups like '%surv%'
select * from bbs where mgroups like '%retro%'
select * from bbs where system like '%mystic%'
column5: |[Y17|[X37|15Mystic BBS |07is one of the most known|[X37|[Y18BBS software of today...

column4: select * from bbs where system like '%synchro%'
column5: |[Y17|[X37|15SynchroNET BBS |07is one of the most old|[X37|[Y18BBS and well known software.

column4: select * from bbs where system like '%enigma%'
column5: |[Y17|[X37|15Enigma BBS |07is a new breeze of|[X37|[Y18BBS software of today...

column4: select * from bbs where os like '%linux%'
select * from bbs where os like '%windows%'
select * from bbs where os like '%raspberry%'
select * from bbs order by name asc
select * from bbs order by name desc
select * from bbs order by nodes asc
column5: wanna brute force? get a dictionary!

column4: select * from bbs order by nodes desc
select * from bbs order by date desc

select * from bbs order by totalcalls desc
